info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 3 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
At 407 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Miccosukee Resort to Doral. Movement was east northeast around 5 to 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Hialeah, Doral, Hialeah Gardens, Miami Springs, Sweetwater, Medley, Fountainbleau, Miccosukee Resort, Tamiami, Miami International Airport, Westchester, University Park, Virginia Gardens, and Fiu South Campus.
info.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Miami-Dade County through 515 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
